result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R. Gesicki

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:00 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM379, 15CM592, AND 15CF324. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Paul Goetz.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to:
In 15CM379: Ct. 1 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF324: Ct. 3 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM592: Ct. 1 (Possession of THC/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF324: Ct. 1 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possession of synthetic cannabinoid - 2nd+ Offense/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Resisting an Officer/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CM592: Ct. 1>>2 years WI State Prison - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
In 15CF324: Ct. 1>>9 years WI State Prison - 4 years IC and 5 years ES. 
                    : Ct. 2>>6 years WI State Prison - 4 years IC and 2 years ES. 
                    : Ct. 4>>2 years WI State Prison - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES in ALL>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions take as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; court costs. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other prison sentence def is serving. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 143 days sentence credit in each file.  
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP on all.
COURT remands def to the sheriff's dept for transport to WI Correctional System. 

Adj: 3:25 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 26, 2015 at 09:10 am.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF324, 15CM379, 15CM592  Called: 9:14am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Deft appears in person/in custody and with Atty Paul Goetz
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  

Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Dates to be set in Br. 3 after this hearing.
Bond:  Continued

C: Br. 3

Adj: 9:17am
Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew R. Gesicki
Current: 4907 N 120th Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 04-03-2015)
Prior: 202 1/2 W Wausau Ave, Wausau, WI 54401

INCLUDES 15CF324, 15CM379, & 15CM592 No driving whatsoever. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.   Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202-Day report.  No contact with T.A., A.S., J.B., J.H., & E.S. except as unavoidable as a result of incarceration. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
